intro: Onosma mugodzharica, commonly known as the Mugodzhar thyme, is a flowering plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the family Boraginaceae and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features hairy, aromatic leaves and produces small, blue to purple flowers in clusters. It thrives in well-drained, rocky soils and is often found in mountainous areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
